timeline.bodyText: What is the use of this assertion?
timeline.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: A sanity check like assertEquals( x + 0, x)?
replies.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: @dkayiwa when i increment with ( x + 1, x) it goes against the real order set attributes that i have in the dataset hence throwing an assertion failure between whats actual and whats is expected
replies.author: gitcliff

replies.bodyText: Let me ask differently, what value does + 0 add to this assertion?

replies.bodyText: honestly nothing and have removed it

timeline.bodyText: What is the use of the above assertion?

replies.author: tendomart

timeline.author: dkayiwa
dkayiwa

timeline.bodyText:
use count - 1
which will ensure that the test does not fail when the number of records in the dataset is changed.
timeline.author: dkayiwa
dkayiwa

timeline.bodyText: Can you also document all the params?
timeline.author: dkayiwa
dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: yes ,the purpose is to first check the number of order set attribute types in the dataset before we can do the purging
replies.author: gitcliff

replies.bodyText: Isn't that taken care of with? initialOrderSetAttributeTypesCount - 1
replies.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: You are simply interested in purging reducing the number by one. It does not matter whether they were 2, 5, 10, or a million.
replies.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: oh i see,,,thanks for the clarification
replies.author: gitcliff

timeline.bodyText: What is the use of this assertion?
timeline.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: @dkayiwa the use of this assertion is first to check and confirm the number of order set attribute types that we currently have in the dataset before we introduce a new one to make it 3
replies.author: gitcliff

timeline.bodyText: Problem with hard coding the number as 2 is that when the test dataset gets changed with more of less records, the test will fail.
